title: Yorkshire breaking news: Latest updates - BBC News
summary: doncaster one-punch killer jailed for 11 years .
sheffield shooting victim named as assel al-essaie , 23 .
three treated in hospital after 'large scale disorder ' at boxing event in leeds .
internet giant amazon to bring hundreds of jobs to yorkshire .
injured army veteran ben parkinson nominated for freeman status .

documents.title: our five top stories today
text: that 's all from us for today , but remember live updates will continue right here throughout this evening and tonight .
before we go , let 's look back at some of our top stories from today :

documents.title: tonight 's weather forecast for yorkshire
text: any rain and drizzle mostly clearing away southwards through the evening , then dry with broken cloud and a minimum temperature of about 5c ( 41f ) .
tuesday will start off mostly dry and bright with some sunshine , although cloud will increase later with the risk of some rain towards evening .
still mild with temperature highs of about 12c ( 54f ) and a moderate southwest wind .
author: Paul Hudson
Weather presenter, BBC Look North

documents.title: listen : schools 'reluctant ' to help over forced marriages
text: a west yorkshire charity says schools need to do more to protect young people from forced marriage .
it comes as victim support group karma nirvana says the number of calls from people in yorkshire asking for help has increased by a fifth .
jasvinder sanghera , from the group , says they 've seen schools reluctant to engage with them :

documents.title: scarborough teen pulled from moped during robbery
text: a teenage boy has been attacked by a man in eastfield in scarborough during a car park robbery .
it happened on the evening of wednesday 1 february when the 16-year-old was pulled from a moped and had his jacket stolen at the car park near the musham bank roundabout .
anyone with information about the incident is being urged to contact police .

documents.title: leeds man breaks record visiting every english league ground
text: a man from west yorkshire has broken the world record for the fastest time to visit all 92 english league grounds .
ed wood , 51 , from leeds , travelled the 22,000 miles in just 189 days , which also included a trip to england based berwick rangers .
ed shaved 48 days off the last record , which also saw him watch 93 games of football , with some games taking place on the same day .
author: Oli Constable
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: east-west divide in transport infrastructure spending
text: the north of england is facing a growing east-west divide on transport investment , according to a new study from think tank the institute for public policy research ( ippr ) .
the yorkshire and humber region will see transport spending worth £ 190 per person over the next five years .
that compares to £ 682 in the north west of england , despite a relatively small difference in population - 5.33 million in yorkshire and humber compared to 7.05 million in the north west .
the study suggests the north west has so far been the major beneficiary of the government 's `` northern powerhouse '' drive .
author: Jim Addyman
BBC Local Live

documents.title: listen : migrant worker demo held in leeds
text: a protest 's taken place in leeds to highlight the importance of migrant workers to the local economy .
dozens of people held hands and formed a chain in briggate as part of the nationwide one day without us demonstrations .
leeds councillor alison lowe joined the crowds :

documents.title: stars come out for anti-homophobia football match
text: just a ball game , a group which fights against homophobia in football , is holding an exhibition match today at bradford college as part of the city 's lgbt history month celebrations .
author: Bradford Telegraph and Argus

documents.title: police appeal after boy hit by car in doncaster
text: a 10-year-old boy needed hospital treatment after he was hit by a car in doncaster .
the incident happened at about 17:35 on friday as the boy was riding his bike over the crossing outside sainsbury 's on sandringham road .
the driver of the car is thought to have stopped after the collision to check how the boy was , before driving away towards tudor road .
anyone who saw the incident is being asked to contact police .

documents.title: leeds rhinos ' jamie jones-buchanan and salford 's justin carney charged by rfl
text: salford red devils back justin carney and leeds rhinos second row jamie jones-buchanan ( have been charged after the latest super league action .
carney , 28 , has been charged with grade c contact with a match official , while jones-buchanan , 35 , is accused of grade a dangerous contact .
salford won 30-20 at huddersfield , while leeds beat leigh 17-14 .
neither player was entitled to an early guilty plea as both had taken within the past 12 months .
neither player was cautioned by match officials during their respective games .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: listen : uk 'ca n't be held back ' on delivering hs2
text: the transport minister has defended the planned hs2 high-speed rail route which will run through south and west yorkshire and into part of north yorkshire , saying the project should n't be derailed because of how it affects homeowners .

hs2 will connect with the east coast main line at the north yorkshire village of church fenton , where residents have already reported negative effects on house prices even though the route wo n't be operational until 2033 .
andrew jones , the mp for harrogate and knaresborough , was speaking during a visit to the national college for high speed rail in doncaster :

documents.title: boxing promoter hearn at bramall lane ahead of summer fight
text: boxing promoter eddie hearn posted this video walking out of the tunnel at bramall lane .
sheffield boxer kell brook could be boxing here in the summer .
the long-time blade has already said he wants to fight at the home of sheffield united .
working to make it happen @ twitterid @ twitterid # brookspence @ twitterid

documents.title: north yorkshire recycling centre to close for two weeks
text: the household waste recycling centre which serves malton and norton is to close for a fortnight .
it 's because of essential work and will shut two weeks today on monday 6 march and will then re-open on monday 20 march .

documents.title: countdown to second phase of victoria gate development
text: the owner of the victoria gate shopping centre in leeds says it expects to have submitted a planning application for the second phase of the development by the end of the year .
hammerson owns land on the opposite side of eastgate which it plans to turn into a shopping and leisure destination .
it comes as the company announces a big drop in profits for the last year .

documents.title: traffic and travel : back to normal on sheffield supertram
text: after problems on a couple of sheffield supertram routes earlier today , it seems things are finally sorted :
blue and yellow routes back to timetable with only minor delays currently .

documents.title: cupboard love at temple newsam
text: it was a marriage proposal 260 years in the making when jeff rowland popped the question with a little help from an antique cabinet at temple newsam in leeds .
jeff , 34 , took his unsuspecting girlfriend , sarah reynolds , 32 , on a valentine 's day trip to the historic house last week to see the tudor mansion 's channon cabinet .
during the tour , a member of the temple newsam team opened each drawer in succession , eventually revealing an engagement ring which had been safely hidden there earlier that day .
originally from australia , jeff and sarah moved to leeds last year after being together for just six weeks so sarah could study for a phd in cultural studies at the university of leeds .
sarah , who accepted jeff 's proposal , says : `` when i spotted the ring , it hit me and i broke down into tears .
it was very overwhelming and an incredibly creative and beautiful way to ask . ''

documents.title: george harrison 's porsche to be sold
text: george harrison 's porsche to be sold

documents.title: cctv appeal after york brawl
text: north yorkshire police have released cctv images of a man they want to speak to in connection with a violent incident in york earlier this month .
the appeal comes after a fight outside the three cranes pub in st sampsons square in york in the early hours of sunday 5 february .
several men were arrested and bailed pending further enquiries .
anyone who recognises the man above is being asked to contact north yorkshire police on 101 .

documents.title: traffic and travel : problems on roads and sheffield 's supertram
text: a few traffic and travel problems are being reported in yorkshire .
these are the latest details :
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: one-punch killer jailed for 11 years
text: a man who killed a doncaster pe teacher with a single punch in an `` unprovoked and senseless '' attack has been jailed for 11 years .
lewis siddall , 24 , from skellow , was found dead in his bed the day after he was attacked by blue horrobin in the vdka bar , doncaster , in 2015 .
a post-mortem examination revealed he died as a result of head injuries .
horrobin , 23 , of highfield road , askern , doncaster , was jailed at sheffield crown court after being found guilty of manslaughter .

documents.title: nominate yorkshire 's music legends
text: we 're celebrating our local music legends by asking for your suggestions on where deserves an official blue plaque .
the bbc is asking you to nominate a singer , songwriter or musician who 's no longer with us , or an iconic place that 's been a major part of yorkshire 's musical heritage .
let us know !
author: BBC Music

documents.title: normanton acro gamble on vegas success
text: many of our budding sports men and women get to travel to foreign championships but normanton sports acro will be making others jealous as they 're destined for las vegas .

but do n't expect them to be hitting the casinos or taking in a show as they have been invited to compete in the vegas acro cup - an international acrobatic gymnastics competition taking place at the end of march .
the club , based in normanton , near wakefield , have been invited to take part in the prestigious event off the back of recent success in turin and are busy raising money for the trip .
holly rowney , runs the club and is excited at the prospect :
author: Charles Heslett
Journalist, BBC Radio Leeds

documents.title: garry monk : fans have to learn that it 's a results business
text: leeds united head coach garry monk says it 's unrealistic to expect any team to keep playing flowing football in the championship .
saturday 's draw at ipswich was a largely uneventful affair and despite the side being comfortably-placed in the playoff spots , some fans are critical of the side .
fans forums in recent weeks have seen some comments that the win against derby in january was the last time the team played really well .
monk says the tough nature of getting out of the division makes consistency difficult :
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: scarborough lions solve transport problem for woman 's care home journey
text: there 's good news for a scarborough pensioner who has to endure four-hour round trips to see her husband in a care home .
margaret lister desperately wants to find a home for her husband martin close to where they live .
at the moment , there are no vacancies in care homes in scarborough so martin , who has dementia and parkinson 's disease , is currently being looked after in a home in bridlington .
because she does n't drive , margaret is reliant on public transport .
fortunately local charity organisation , the scarborough lions , have stepped in and can help provide transport for margaret .
this was her reaction when i spoke to her and roy chambers from the lions on the bbc radio york breakfast show :
author: Kay Crewdson
BBC Radio York

documents.title: four leeds men receive long prison sentences for violent robberies
text: four men from the halton moor area of leeds have received prison sentences totalling more than 96 years after a series of armed robberies at homes and businesses across the city .
they used firearms , machetes , axes and hammers to carry out their crimes , which included violent raids in roundhay , collingham , and alwoodley .
author: Yorkshire Evening Post

documents.title: huddersfield town : whitehead glad to be back in the action
text: huddersfield town midfielder dean whitehead is hoping his performance against manchester city in saturday 's gripping fa cup draw , will help him become a first team regular once more .
whitehead has had to wait for his chance to feature in the town line-up recently , but says he 's ready to go whenever he is selected again :
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: brawl at leeds boxing event
text: police are investigating after what they are describing as `` large scale disorder '' at a boxing event in leeds .
the brawl broke out at elland road 's centenary pavilion on saturday night and saw three people needing hospital treatment for minor injuries .

documents.title: single-punch killer to be sentenced today
text: a man who hit and killed a teacher with a single punch in an `` unprovoked '' attack will be sentenced today .
blue horrobin , 23 , punched 24-year-old lewis siddall ( from skellow , in a doncaster bar in august .
mr siddall was later found dead at his home .
horrobin , of highfield road , askern , doncaster , was found guilty of manslaughter at sheffield crown court last month .
a post-mortem examination found mr siddall , a pe teacher , died from a head injury .

documents.title: a look inside the new high speed rail college
text: transport minister andrew jones has been visiting the national college for high speed rail in doncaster to see how work is progressing there .
the £ 25m building is due open to students in september with the aim of training thousands of new engineers to work on the proposed hs2 route .
author: Charlotte Rose
BBC Radio Sheffield Political Reporter

documents.title: have you got a nest egg - or is the cupboard bare ?
text: the average family in our region apparently has about £ 3,000 in savings , according to a new report .
that 's just under the national average - which itself has fallen by about one third over the past year .

the report , commissioned by insurance and investment company aviva , says low-income families earning £ 1,500 or less per month now ty have just £ 95 sitting in savings and investments , excluding money being saved into pensions .

documents.title: victoria gate owners see severe drop in profits
text: the company which owns the new victoria gate development in leeds has reported a dramatic fall in its profits after booking heavy losses on the value of its property portfolio .
author: Yorkshire Post

documents.title: brew-ha-ha as yorkshire tea teapots recalled
text: teapots and ceramics promoting yorkshire tea are being recalled after customers reported breakages were happening as they brewed up .
the bases of some one litre teapots have reportedly fractured and fallen out during normal use , according to taylors of harrogate , the makers of yorkshire tea .
the products affected have the `` of harrogate '' part of the taylors logo written in a lower case font , rather than the old-style upper case .
anyone with one of these products is being urged to get in touch with yorkshire tea , to arrange a refund .

documents.title: york city knights coach : 'we 're expected to be at top end of table '
text: york city knights coach james ford admits he was disappointed with some members of his squad as they opened their season with a home defeat in the league 1 cup .
the knights lost 17-16 to north wales crusaders at bootham crescent who landed a match-winning drop goal in extra time .
ash robson had an opportunity to be a knights hero via the `` golden point '' , but miscued his drop goal attempt .
crusaders stand-off james handsome then grabbed the glory when his drop goal was successful .
ford says his players need to meet expectations :
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: internet giant bringing hundreds of jobs to yorkshire
text: amazon is promising 500 new jobs when it opens a new warehouse in doncaster this summer .
the internet retailer says the jobs come at a time of growing demand and will be the company 's third such facility in doncaster .
it 's part of a larger nationwide plan to create 5,000 new full-time jobs in the uk this year , with staff including software developers and warehouse staff .
author: BBC Business News

documents.title: driver arrested after serious crash
text: this was the scene last night after a crash in garforth , leeds which caused serious injuries .
west yorkshire police 's roads policing unit says the head-on crash happened because of a drink- driver and one person has been arrested :
garforth , leeds - serious injury rtc caused by a drink driver , now detained .
head on .
lucky to be alive .
do n't drink and drive .
hope the innocent party are ok. about time justice came down harder on drink drivers .
zero tolerance !
i do hope the drink drive is made to pay the costs of your time & @ twitterid @ twitterid

was this tonight ?
might explain the extra traffic on main street

looks like near the garden centre hope the innocent driver makes quick and full recovery
@ twitterid

documents.title: morrisons recall meat product
text: bradford supermarket chain morrisons has recalled one of its cooked meat products over concerns it may be contaminated .
the worry is that the meat product concerned may have listeria - a bacteria that can cause flu-like symptoms .
the supermarket has asked customers who bought its 150g ready to eat peppered beef slices to return them for a refund .
the product has a use-by date of tuesday 21 february 2017 .
author: Jim Addyman
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : yorkshire mp talks about the 'shame ' of having alcoholic parents
text: don valley mp caroline flint says she 's launching a campaign to help children of alcoholics , because they do n't get enough help .
she says help goes to the parents and young people are being overlooked .
speaking on the andrew marr show on sunday , ms flint says as a child of alcoholics herself she understands the shame and secrecy for children .
author: Charlotte Rose
BBC Radio Sheffield Political Reporter

documents.title: watch : veteran soldier awarded freedom of doncaster
text: ben parkinson has been nominated for the freedom of doncaster .
lance bombardier parkinson was seriously injured in a taliban bomb blast in 2006 in afghanistan .
he had both legs amputated and suffered brain damage .
he now carries out charity work .
author: Kevin Larkin
BBC Local Live, Sheffield

documents.title: baby you can drive my car : beatle 's porsche goes for sale
text: a man who bought a porsche to use for spare parts was surprised to find it had belonged to george harrison .
raj sedha , from leeds , said his wife spotted harrison 's name on the log book , telling him : `` he 's the beatle .
you ca n't take the car apart for spares . ''
george harrison , who died in 2001 , bought the car in 1980 .
it was later sold to mr sedha who is selling it at auction where it is expected to fetch £ 20,000 .

documents.title: calls for increase in penalties for animal cruelty
text: battersea dogs home says the maximum prison sentence for people convicted of animal cruelty should be increased ten-fold , to five years behind bars .
they says the courts should be able to hand out tougher sentences , pointing out that a conviction for fly-tipping can result in a five year jail term .
in west yorkshire , recent cases involve a bradford pair being given a suspended sentence for leaving dozens of dogs in squalid conditions at a farm .

elsewhere , a leeds vet received a suspended sentence and a lifetime ban from working with animals , after dogs were found locked in cages in a `` pitch-black , filthy dungeon '' at his practice in armley .
author: Jim Addyman
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cop a load of this !
text: there were lots of police in rotherham this weekend ahead of a rally .
and it seems they 've started their recruitment early
pc reed ( the one on the right ) snapped this photo of him and pc tommy keeping the lovely people of rotherham free from trouble .

documents.title: wrong kind of punch-up at leeds boxing event
text: violence broke out among spectators at a boxing event at elland road 's centenary pavilion in leeds last night .
west yorkshire police had to be called to what they termed `` large scale disorder '' as sporadic fighting broke out and some audience members began to throw chairs .
it 's believed the scenes , involving hundreds of spectators , were sparked by anger over a judges ' decision .
the event was hosted by the golden gloves boxing league , who apologised via their facebook page for cancelling the show 's main event , saying police `` pulled the plug '' .
author: Jim Addyman
BBC Local Live

documents.title: subsidence problems being linked to former mine
text: a group 's been set-up to try to tackle problems with subsidence thought to be caused by a north yorkshire coal mine .
even though mining has ended at kellingley , problems continue in the village of hensall including huge cracks appearing in walls and ceilings .
hazel hardgrave says she was left with no option but to leave the house she 'd lived in for 47 years :
author: Jim Addyman
BBC Local Live

documents.title: transport minister on rail visit as protesters prepare for hs2 fight
text: the transport minister and mp for harrogate & knaresborough , andrew jones will visit the site of the national college for high speed rail in doncaster today .
it 's currently under construction and due to open in september .
it 's expected to train thousands of new engineers to work on developments such as the hs2 rail line .
a protest against the route is also taking place in west yorkshire later .
author: Jim Addyman
BBC Local Live

documents.title: breakingman named in sheffield shooting
text: the man who was killed in a shooting in the upperthorpe area of sheffield has been named as assel al-essaie .
the 23-year-old was shot in the chest at around 13:35 on saturday 18 february .
a 30-year-old man has been arrested on sus of conspiracy to commit murder .
he is being questioned by police .
author: Oli Constable
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: problems on sheffield trams today
text: sheffield supertram have just sent out this service update .
there 's problems on the tram service between middlewood & hillsborough this morning .

documents.title: injured army veteran nominated for freeman status
text: a local soldier has been nominated for the freedom of doncaster borough .
lance bombardier ben parkinson mbe , 32 , was seriously injured in afghanistan , losing both his legs and has since done a lot of charity work .
councillors in doncaster will decide on the nomination at a meeting next month .
ben has been describing his reaction to being nominated :
author: Jim Addyman
BBC Local Live

documents.title: leeds protest will see activists support migrant workers
text: activists will stage a demonstration in leeds later to show support for migrant workers - and highlight how they help the west yorkshire economy .
it 's all part of a day of action called `` one day without us '' , organised in response to what they see as a rising tide of xenophobia .
janet oldroyd-hume runs a farm near wakefield .
she says she ca n't find english people willing to work the long hours for her so migrant workers are invaluable : .
author: Jim Addyman
BBC Local Live

documents.title: traffic building on the m606
text: there 's heavy traffic on the m606 southbound at the m62 junction 26 a58 chain bar .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: weather this monday morning
text: often cloudy over hills with occasional rain or drizzle and mist and fog .
many eastern areas will be drier , perhaps very mild with sunny spells .
all areas becoming dry by evening .

documents.title: sheffield fatal shooting : investigations continue
text: investigations will continue today after a 23-year-old man was shot dead in sheffield on saturday afternoon .
the unnamed victim was injured on daniel hill terrace , upperthorpe , near the city centre and later died from his injuries .
witnesses said the man was either in , or close to , a black mercedes car he had been driving when he was shot .
south yorkshire police has appealed for information over the killing , which is the latest in a spate of shootings across the city in recent weeks .
author: Jim Addyman
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your yorkshire sport news this morning
text: huddersfield town will have to travel to middlesbrough in the fa cup quarter finals if they get by manchester city .
they drew 0-0 with pep guardiola 's men on saturday to force a replay .
doncaster rovers manager darren ferguson ( above ) has branded the elbowing of striker john marquis a disgrace .
the forward is alleged to have been struck by luton 's danny hylton in saturday 's 1-1 draw .
coach james ford admitted he was disappointed with some members of his york city knights squad as they opened their season with a narrow 17-16 defeat to north wales crusaders in the league 1 cup .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: your early headlines this morning
text: the latest news from bbc newsrooms across yorkshire include :
author: Jim Addyman
BBC Local Live

documents.title: good morning : join us for today 's live coverage
text: i 'll be with you until 14:00 with all the latest news , travel and weather from across yorkshire .
we 'd love to see your like this beautiful rainbow over meltham , near huddersfield sent in by bbc weather watcher sandie 's valley .
you can get in touch and send your photos via twitter , facebook or email .
author: Jim Addyman
BBC Local Live
